artist: Engraver: Peter de Jode, the Younger; Painter: After Anselmus van Hulle
description: bust length portrait of man facing left looking at viewer; wearing armor; flat white collar; clasp at enter front has ram in a ring pendant; in an oval cartouche with coat of arms and crown at top; drapery, fruit and foliage around with pair of eagles holding trumpets in beak at bottom; inscribed plaque below and inscription on oval frame
inscription:
Signature, Title, and Inscription

in plate around frame in black: [IINNUMERIS POTIOR PAX UNA TRIUMPHIS];  on plaque below image in black: [FERDINANDUS CAROLUS/ DEI GRATIA ARCHDUX AUSTRIÆ DUX/ BURGUNDIÆ STIRIÆ, CARINTHIÆ, ET WURTENBURGÆ, COMES/ TYROLIS ET GORITIÆ. ETC./ Anselmus van Hulle pinxit  Petrus de Jode sculpsit  7]; on sheet in pencil: [1-584]
title: Portrait of Ferdinandus Carolus
